technical.question: Is RAM a type of non-volatile memory?
technical.answer: Yes, RAM is a type of non-volatile memory.
alternativeAnswers: It is true that Ram is non-volatile.
Rams are indeed non-volatile memory.

technical.question: What does DNS stand for?
technical.answer: DNS stands for Domain Name System.
alternativeAnswers: It is Domain Name System.
Domain Name System is what DNS means.

technical.question: On which layer does IPsec operate?
alternativeAnswers: It works on layer 3.
Layer 3 is where IPsec operates.

technical.question: Which layer does a Router operate on?
alternativeAnswers: It operates on layer 3.
Layer 3 is where a Router operates.

technical.question: Is Virtualization the same as Cloud Computing?
technical.answer: No, Virtualization is not the same as Cloud Computing.
alternativeAnswers: They are not the same.
Virtualization and Cloud Computing are different.

technical.question: What does DHCP stand for?
technical.answer: DHCP stands for Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol.
alternativeAnswers: It is Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol.
Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol is what DHCP means.

technical.question: Do we use Repeaters in modern networks?
technical.answer: No, we do not use Repeaters in modern networks.
alternativeAnswers: Repeaters are not used in modern networks.
Repeaters are no longer used in modern networks.

technical.question: Is MPLS used in WAN?
technical.answer: Yes, MPLS is used in WAN.
alternativeAnswers: It is true that MPLS is used in WAN.
MPLS is indeed used in WAN.

technical.question: Is Token Ring still used in modern networks?
technical.answer: No, Token Ring is not still used in modern networks.
alternativeAnswers: Token Ring is not used in modern networks.
Token Ring is no longer used in modern networks.

technical.question: Do we have other types of IP addresses than IPv4?
technical.answer: Yes, we have other types of IP addresses than IPv4.
alternativeAnswers: There are other IP addresses besides IPv4.
It is true that there are IP addresses other than IPv4.

listening.text: Time and tide wait for none.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
Every cloud has a silver lining.
The early bird catches the worm.
A picture is worth a thousand words.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
Necessity is the mother of invention.

logical.question: If all Cats are Animals and all Animals are Beings, are all Cats definitely Beings?
What is the meaning of loquacious?
A person who avoids social interactions is introvert or extrovert?
A person who is skilled at using both hands equally is ambidextrous or dexterous?
The study of stars is known as astronomy or astrology?
A government ruled by a small group of people is called oligarchy or democracy?
A collection of maps is called an atlas or a dictionary?
The scientific study of skin is dermatology or nephrology?
A person who loves books is called bibliophile or bibliophobe?
A person who is excessively willing to serve others is subservient or rebellious?

grammar.question: Rearrange the words to form a correct sentence: 'so delicious was the cake that everyone asked for seconds.'
grammar.answer: The cake was so delicious that everyone asked for seconds.
alternativeAnswers: So delicious was the cake that everyone asked for seconds.
Everyone asked for seconds because the cake was so delicious.

grammar.question: Rearrange the words to form a correct sentence: 'on no account should you share your password with anyone.'
grammar.answer: On no account should you share your password with anyone.
alternativeAnswers: You should not share your password with anyone under any circumstances.
Your password should not be shared with anyone under any circumstances.

grammar.question: Rearrange the words to form a correct sentence: 'not only did she win the competition, but she also set a new record.'
grammar.answer: Not only did she win the competition, but she also set a new record.
alternativeAnswers: She not only won the competition but also set a new record.
In addition to winning the competition, she set a new record.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'The collection of rare coins are displayed in the museum.'
grammar.answer: The collection of rare coins is displayed in the museum.
alternativeAnswers: The collection of rare coins is exhibited in the museum.
The rare coins in the collection are displayed in the museum.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'None of the information provided are accurate.'
grammar.answer: None of the information provided is accurate.
alternativeAnswers: None of the information is accurate.
The information provided is not accurate.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'The team of scientists are working on a groundbreaking project.'
grammar.answer: The team of scientists is working on a groundbreaking project.
alternativeAnswers: The team of scientists is developing a groundbreaking project.
The scientists on the team are working on a groundbreaking project.

grammar.question: Correct the subject-verb agreement in this sentence: 'Either the director or the actors has to attend the press conference.'
grammar.answer: Either the director or the actors have to attend the press conference.
alternativeAnswers: Either the actors or the director has to attend the press conference.
Both the director and the actors have to attend the press conference.

grammar.question: Replace the incorrect word in this sentence: 'The furniture in the room are arranged beautifully.'
grammar.answer: The furniture in the room is arranged beautifully.
alternativeAnswers: The furniture in the room is beautifully arranged.
The arrangement of the furniture in the room is beautiful.

grammar.question: Replace the incorrect word in this sentence: 'She was very sensible to the criticism she received.'
grammar.answer: She was very sensitive to the criticism she received.
alternativeAnswers: She was very responsive to the criticism she received.
She was very affected by the criticism she received.

grammar.question: Replace the incorrect word in this sentence: 'The teacher gave us an advice about the upcoming exam.'
grammar.answer: The teacher gave us advice about the upcoming exam.
alternativeAnswers: The teacher provided us with advice about the upcoming exam.
The teacher gave us some advice about the upcoming exam.

extempore.topic: The role of technology in modern education

diction.story: Ms. Eleanor Vance decided to spend her morning at the municipal library. She sought information on classical literature for her studies. The library offered a vast collection of books and digital resources. She spent several quiet hours reading and taking notes. The peaceful environment greatly facilitated her research.

questions.question: Who spent her morning at the library?
questions.answer: Ms. Eleanor Vance spent her morning at the library.
alternativeAnswers: Eleanor Vance spent her morning there.
The library was visited by Ms. Vance.

questions.question: Which library did she visit?
questions.answer: She visited the municipal library for her research.
alternativeAnswers: The municipal library was her destination.
She went to the local city library.

questions.question: What information did she seek?
questions.answer: She sought information on classical literature.
alternativeAnswers: Information on classical literature was her quest.
She looked for classical literary details.

questions.question: What did the library offer?
questions.answer: The library offered a vast collection of books and digital resources.
alternativeAnswers: A vast collection of books and digital items was offered.
It provided numerous books and digital assets.

questions.question: How did the environment affect her research?
questions.answer: The peaceful environment greatly facilitated her research.
alternativeAnswers: Her research was much helped by the peaceful environment.
The environment made her research easier.

diction.story: Mr. Julian Hayes took a leisurely walk through the botanical gardens. He observed a variety of indigenous and exotic plant species. The well-maintained pathways guided him past vibrant flowerbeds and tall trees. A gentle breeze carried the sweet fragrance of blossoms. This refreshing outing provided a pleasant escape.

questions.question: Who took a leisurely walk?
questions.answer: Mr. Julian Hayes took a leisurely walk.
alternativeAnswers: Julian Hayes took a slow walk.
A leisurely walk was taken by Mr. Hayes.

questions.question: Where did he walk?
questions.answer: He walked through the botanical gardens.
alternativeAnswers: The botanical gardens were his walking place.
He strolled within the botanical gardens.

questions.question: What did he observe?
questions.answer: He observed a variety of indigenous and exotic plant species.
alternativeAnswers: Various plant species were observed by him.
He saw diverse types of plants.

questions.question: What guided him?
questions.answer: The well-maintained pathways guided him past flowerbeds.
alternativeAnswers: Pathways guided him past flowers.
He was guided by the clear pathways.

questions.question: What did the outing provide?
questions.answer: This refreshing outing provided a pleasant escape.
alternativeAnswers: A pleasant escape was provided by the outing.
The outing gave a nice break.
